exercises.name: Focus Ball Game
exercises.explanation: Follow the bouncing ball with your eyes only, no head movement!
exercises.benefit: Improves focus and eye muscle control

exercises.name: Palming Relaxation
exercises.explanation: Rub your hands together and place them over your closed eyes, imagining a peaceful scene.
exercises.benefit: Relaxes eye muscles and reduces strain

exercises.name: Tracking Movement Exercise
exercises.explanation: Move your finger in different directions and follow it only with your eyes.

day_1_content.hydration_tip: Create a sticker chart for every glass of water you drink today!
day_1_content.child_message: Your eyes are superheroes — let's train them like champions!
day_1_content.parent_nudge: Model 20-20-20 breaks by doing them together during TV time.

exercises.name: Blurry Vision Focus Game
exercises.explanation: Switch your focus between a near object and a far object to train your eyes.
exercises.benefit: Helps with blurry vision by improving focus

exercises.name: Eye Strain Relief Palming
exercises.explanation: Rub your hands together and place them gently over your closed eyes to relax.
exercises.benefit: Relieves eye strain and relaxes eye muscles

exercises.name: Astigmatism Tracking Exercise
exercises.explanation: Follow a moving object with your eyes to help improve tracking.
exercises.benefit: Improves eye tracking and aids in astigmatism

exercises.name: Focus Switch with Pen
exercises.explanation: Hold a pen at arm's length and focus on it, then switch focus to an object 20 feet away.
exercises.benefit: Helps improve focus and reduces blurry vision.

exercises.name: Palming Relaxation
exercises.explanation: Gently cover your closed eyes with your palms and relax.
exercises.benefit: Provides general relaxation and reduces eye strain.

exercises.name: Astigmatism Tracking
exercises.explanation: Track a moving object horizontally and vertically without moving your head.
exercises.benefit: Helps improve astigmatism by enhancing eye tracking abilities.
